Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: I believe that what’s polite for some may not be polite for others

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: I understand that but there are common standards of polite behavior

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: What if students don’t say thank you for doing something nice? What would you do?

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: I do not have the role of surveying what every student might say. But if I notice that, I would note it and inform the instructor.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: Many students don’t even tidy up after their lunch and others always have to take responsibility for their indecent behavior.

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: I play basketball so I have seen a lot of impolite behavior on the field. But I don’t think scolding is the right way to tackle it.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: I agree. Getting others to act differently requires a lot of patience.

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: exactly. Sometimes it may not be possible that everybody changes. That’s why we have guidelines to protect all students

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: I have been on the other side too. I’d suggest starting a reward system.

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: Thanks for understanding. I’d be happy to hear your suggestions.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: We can reduce instances of impolite behavior by rewarding polite behavior

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: Absolutely! That way all students can see how it feels like to be kind!

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: exactly. Will you be taking note of all the students who behave politely?

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: Well, I can do that, but we can all do it together. Whenever any student notices polite behavior, they can nominate those students by writing on the notice board.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: perfect! Will we be starting this right away? And how can we adjust this to keeping the classroom tidy?

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: oh, I am in discussions with our instructor about that. I don’t have an answer at the moment. But when I bring it up, we can discuss that with other students.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: Great! I hope it works! I am sure you will do a good job of implementing it.

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: I hope so too. We will have to try and see.

Assertive.name: Luna
Assertive.talk: Thank you for your efforts to bring change. I believe in you!

Assertive.name: Samantha
Assertive.talk: thank you for your efforts too and for believing in me!
